ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 111 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 111 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This class is an introduction to Portuguese grammar with lots of cultural activities woven into the curriculum. It moves quickly, but in a manageable way. It covers most verb tenses and is heavy on speaking.

This is a great course for students who have a strong background in romance languages and wish to quickly learn Portuguese. This course has a strong emphasis on grammar as well as conversational Portuguese. While the workload is low, the speed of the course can sometimes be a burden. This course is especially good for those that can pick up languages quickly. If you are a slow learner of languages, however, this course is not for you.

I definitely recommend this course to another student. If you are willing to put in the work, you get a lot out of the class. My class was only 6 people and we bonded well over the course of the semester as we faced trials and tribulations from the coursework. Expect tons of inside jokes, laughter, learning, and a good time during this course.
